body:
@sergeykolychev  Thanks a lot for your reply. As you recommended, I added `/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/` into `LD_LIBRARY_PATH`:
```
> $ locate libcuda.so                                                                                                                                                                                       
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libcuda.so.1
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libcuda.so.384.59
/usr/lib32/libcuda.so
/usr/lib32/libcuda.so.1
/usr/lib32/libcuda.so.384.59
/usr/local/cuda-8.0/doc/man/man7/libcuda.so.7
/usr/local/cuda-8.0/lib64/stubs/libcuda.so
/usr/share/man/man7/libcuda.so.7
>$ echo $LD_LIBRARY_PATH
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu:/usr/local/cuda/lib64:/usr/local/cudnn5.1/lib64
```
And added this `ADD_LDFLAGS += -L/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/` to `config.mk`.
But this error still shows up:
```
-lcudnn -L/usr/local/cuda/lib64 -L/usr/local/cuda/cudnn5.1/lib64 -L/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu -lcuda -lcufft -lnvrtc
/usr/bin/ld: cannot find -lcuda
collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
Makefile:384: recipe for target 'lib/libmxnet.so' failed
make: *** [lib/libmxnet.so] Error 1
make: *** Waiting for unfinished jobs....
/usr/bin/ld: cannot find -lcuda
collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
Makefile:406: recipe for target 'bin/im2rec' failed
make: *** [bin/im2rec] Error 1
```
Do you now how to check the installation of nvidia-dirver? I can use `nvidia-smi` and Tensorflow can use the GPUs in this box.

you are missing libcuda.so symlink to libcuda.so.1
I do not know why is that but I think
```
sudo ln -s /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libcuda.so.1 /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libcuda.so
```
will fix your problem.
Did you build mxnet with USE_CPP_PACKAGE=1. This will generate the op.h that you are looking for in cpp-package/include/mxnet-cpp/op.h
Thank you for your advise, it seems I turned that on, but still not generate op.h,. I am going to make again.
@sergeykolychev I didn't notice this problem. Thanks for your remind and the problem was fixed.

Flaky as they are, they still catch problems. It's better than being disabled.

If you have time please do investigate.
@benqua could you rebase the pr and re-trigger the CI build?
@benqua could you rebase the pr and re-trigger the CI build?
Rebased. Waiting for the CI to complete.
Rebased. Waiting for the CI to complete.
why? this can break user code

My mistake, I meant general compression interface, not general n-bit compression interface.
For now we can have 2bit and float16 after merging these 2 PRs.

Can't you just send compression='float16' to the server? Similar to how you sent '2bit'
BTW @cjolivier01 This PR just does not get built at all, since 6 days. Is it better I push it again regularly, or wait until it finally gets in? Or is it "too old" now to get in?
You need to enable c++11 (at least) for your project compilation, add -std=c++11 flag that is.
I've installed manually with whl package form https://pypi.python.org/pypi/mxnet-cu75/0.12.0b20171027

@lebeg Hi, so many thanks for your reply, after turn on c++ 11, things seems got a very far reach, but it still gives me some errors:

```
Undefined symbols for architecture x86_64:
  "cv::Mat::deallocate()", referenced from:
      mxnet::Imdecode(mxnet::NDArray*, mxnet::NDArray, unsigned long, unsigned long, unsigned long, unsigned long, unsigned long, unsigned long, unsigned long, char*) in libmxnet_static.a(ndarray.cc.o)
  "cv::error(int, cv::String const&, char const*, char const*, int)", referenced from:
      cv::Mat::Mat(int, int, int, void*, unsigned long) in libmxnet_static.a(ndarray.cc.o)
  "cv::String::deallocate()", referenced from:
      cv::Mat::Mat(int, int, int, void*, unsigned long) in libmxnet_static.a(ndarray.cc.o)
  "cv::String::allocate(unsigned long)", referenced from:
      cv::Mat::Mat(int, int, int, void*, unsigned long) in libmxnet_static.a(ndarray.cc.o)
  "cv::fastFree(void*)", referenced from:
      mxnet::Imdecode(mxnet::NDArray*, mxnet::NDArray, unsigned long, unsigned long, unsigned long, unsigned long, unsigned long, unsigned long, unsigned long, char*) in libmxnet_static.a(ndarray.cc.o)
  "cv::imdecode(cv::_InputArray const&, int)", referenced from:
      mxnet::Imdecode(mxnet::NDArray*, mxnet::NDArray, unsigned long, unsigned long, unsigned long, unsigned long, unsigned long, unsigned long, unsigned long, char*) in libmxnet_static.a(ndarray.cc.o)
  "dmlc::RecordIOReader::NextRecord(std::__1::basic_string<char, std::__1::char_traits<char>, std::__1::allocator<char> >*)", referenced from:
      _MXRecordIOReaderReadRecord in libmxnet_static.a(c_api.cc.o)
  "dmlc::RecordIOWriter::WriteRecord(void const*, unsigned long)", referenced from:
      _MXRecordIOWriterWriteRecord in libmxnet_static.a(c_api.cc.o)
  "dmlc::Stream::Create(char const*, char const*, bool)", referenced from:
      _MXNDArraySave in libmxnet_static.a(c_api.cc.o)
      _MXNDArrayLoad in libmxnet_static.a(c_api.cc.o)
      _MXRecordIOWriterCreate in libmxnet_static.a(c_api.cc.o)
      _MXRecordIOReaderCreate in libmxnet_static.a(c_api.cc.o)
      _MXSymbolCreateFromFile in libmxnet_static.a(c_api_symbolic.cc.o)
      _MXSymbolSaveToFile in libmxnet_static.a(c_api_symbolic.cc.o)
ld: symbol(s) not found for architecture x86_64
clang: error: linker command failed with exit code 1 (use -v to see invocation)
```

This is caused by OpenCV, but I disabled it when I build mxnet, why it still give me the error, if I want fix it, should I install opencv and link it in my project or there are anyother solutions?
Finally!
Only 6 days? Looks like things are finally speeding up.

it does break codes. but the current problems are 1) not every network is for classification, so output is a better name compared to classifier. 2) the classifier contains too many things than just the last output layer, e.g. AlexNet has all Dense layers in classifier.
is there an update on this issue? we are keen to include MKL in an upcoming project.
is there an update on this issue? we are keen to include MKL in an upcoming project.
@piiswrong I would like to know how to set attributes of the arguments. For example, in LeakyReLU I would like to set 'wd_mult = 0'

@ykim362 stated that he started working on this a while back, but there's no update from him yet.

Help on finding the root cause is welcome.
Going to close and reopen to see if Jenkins starts to see this PR
That worked :)
Try adding MXNET_USE_OPENCV=0 to your project's flags?
Instead of using `init.Constant`, try `self.params.get('A', shape=A.shape, grad_req='null')` and set it to a fixed value after initialization `l.A.set_data(xx)`

Can you express your new activation in mx.nd primitives? If so, just use no activation in the linear, and concatenate with your code for the nonlinearity. You have to write this in mx.nd in order to be efficient, Python won't do.

If you need a new nonlinearity, not included in mx.nd, you'd have to extend MXNet, in particular src/operator/mshadow_op.h, and also register a new operator. This is a bit tricky, but you can ask me, I just did it.

But please do make sure you cannot express your function with existing ones: a lot of things are perfectly possible with mx.nd. Check mx.nd.where, which is useful for your piecewise defined functions.
What is your hardware setup? cuDNN supports devices with compute capabilites of greater than or equal to 3.0 only.
cc @cjolivier01 @piiswrong I just squash merged this

Nice, can you put some instruction of how to use your operators? @solin319 
And I cannot find the performance in either your repo or the original caffe one.
What does your training data look like? Can you please provide your full script. I was able to run the script with mx.symbol.LogisticRegressionOutput instead of LinearRegressionOutput.
Can this be merged?
can this be merged?

ping.
Can we use all the archs from CUDA_ARCH instead of querying the first device? There can be multiple devices with different compute capability.
ah! simple enough, thanks!

Build MXNet with new pooling and upsampling operators.
```
# copy new operators to src/operator/
cp segnet/op/* incubator-mxnet/src/operator/
# rebuild MXNet from source
cd incubator-mxnet/
make
cd python/
python setup.py install
```
What actually loads libgfortran? Is it libc? Blas library? Low-level gcc libraries?

Btw, if Gu load libgfortran and things start going faster, but cpu utilization goes down, this doesnt imply that libgfortran is limiting cpu usage. Mxnet, like just about every multithreaded system, does not run with perfect concurrency at every point in the execution process. That doesnt mean that there isnt a bottleneck somewhere (ie file IO, memory cache misses) that could be improved, but I dont think it necessarily points to libgfortran forcibly slowing things down.
@cjolivier01 Thanks for your explanation. Close it for now.

I need the scala bindings on windows. The windows build instructions require Visual Studio 2013 which I can't find for download. Could you at least update the build instructions for W10?

Thanks!
Yes, please merge it. I rebase to master. This triggers Jenkins again, but please do not wait (there are no changes of mine).
Yes, fine. This is fixing a nasty bug
@piiswrong  ping
yes. please merge.
@piiswrong

Merge is blocked by GitHub until CI completes successfully.

On Sat, Oct 28, 2017 at 2:05 AM mseeger <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> Yes, please merge it. I rebase to master. This triggers Jenkins again, but
> please do not wait (there are no changes of mine).
>
> 
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/apache/incubator-mxnet/pull/8361#issuecomment-340162717>,
> or mute the thread
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AKts_YUHQaTkTC7kmdf-Zr56PkkmEhwIks5swu5kgaJpZM4QA0zG>
> .
>

It's just that the `NegativeLogLikelihood` metric requires the prediction results are of shape (num_sample, 2) for 2-class classification. If you use `MSE ` as the metric, you won't see that err message. 
Another way is register your own metric which calculates based on pred of shape (num_sample,1) and label (num_sample, 1)
Let me know if that helps.
https://github.com/apache/incubator-mxnet/pull/8460

szha,

   Any update?
Still tuning parameters, sit tight
I'm closing this for now. If we do want to implement this feature in the future, it should be done with a new parameter
could you rebase?
Symbol is fine in the folder you mentioned. If you have optimizer to push, put them in python/mxnet/optimizer.py if you think these optimizers are widely useful to other users.
Can you figure out what's the difference with the one in caffe? Like data augmentation difference that caused the degraded perf?
